result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Ross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 3 days time served. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 1 YEAR.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA);
- Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.

- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm.
- Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Ross

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Defendant David A Ross in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for David A Ross.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered charge DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
 
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center. Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 12 MONTHS probation. Defendant is eligible for early release of probation to be determined by the agent.

Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- DNA sample.
- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor. 
- Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Court allows for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation 
- Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 6 months. 

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following within 1 YEAR.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant David A Ross in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requested plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 11.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
all conditions of bail remain as previously set.

Defendant David A Ross in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran; both appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Franke. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. 
*Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

04:50 PM Attorney James Edgar Toran in court by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Court will address with the parties on the next court date

Defendant David A Ross in court with attorney James Edgar Toran in court by telephone.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Toran has been retained as counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant David A Ross in court.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called.  Case passed.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated June 10, 2022 - received
JusticePoint Status Report dated May 20, 2022 - received
Indigency hearing on June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David A Ross in court, in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant David A Ross in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant David A Ross in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David A Ross appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
